comments:
I am running Eclipse SDK Version: 3.2.2 Build id: M20070212-1330 (compete config 
at the end of this message) on a MacBook Pro in Java 1.5.  When I run my app in 
debug mode I get an extremely strange exception from the JarLoader. See 
stacktrace below. 
 
The URL in question seems to be: 
file:/private/var/tmp/Java3D/Java3D-19.obj~2/UninstalledProducts/j3dcore.jar 
 
I don't know where that comes from, but I am fairly sure this has nothing to do 
with my system. I have no idea though whether this is an Eclipse, or a JDK 
problem (it appears to be the latter). 
 
I included all the error logs and info I could find in this email. 
 
Any suggestions for a fix or a work around are highly appreciated. 
 
Thanks, 
 
Erwin

The debugger suspends on uncaught exceptions by default... what happens if you just turn off the debugger prefernce? or resume the app? (see "Java > Debug" preference page - "suspend execution on uncaught exceptions").

Also, see the README for 3.2.2:

Debugging on MacOS requires manual change to eclipse.ini:
In order for the Eclipse Java debugger to use its own JDI implementation, the boot path of Eclipse must be modified. This requires editing the eclipse.ini file to reference the correct version of the Java debug plug-in's JDI jar. The correct version for 3.2.2 is org.eclipse.jdt.debug_3.2.2.r322_v20070130/jdi.jar. An updated version of the eclipse.ini file can be found on bug 174804.
Marking as invalid. Report shows the debugger is stopping on an uncaught exception, which is expected behvaior.
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991
